conclusion: Analyze the relationship between velocity and displacement using the graph of 1/v versus x.
The graph shows 1/v on the y-axis and displacement x on the x-axis as a straight line with a positive slope.
A straight line can be described by the equation y = mx + c.
The equation of the line is 1/v = mx + c.
Rearrange the equation to solve for v: v = 1/(mx + c).
v is inversely proportional to mx + c.
As x increases, mx + c increases because m is positive.
An increase in mx + c results in a decrease in v.
If v decreases as x increases, the particle is decelerating.
